[STRUCTURE]: The text jumps between different ideas and topics without clear transitions (e.g., from Tyndall to Spencer, then to various scientific fields)
[LOGIC]: Some arguments are presented but not fully developed or connected to the main thesis
The text references specific works and authors (like Sartor Resartus) without sufficient context for the reader
[CLARITY]: The text occasionally uses complex or abstract language that makes the meaning unclear
[TRANSITION]: The flow between paragraphs is sometimes abrupt, making it difficult to follow the author's train of thought

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex and fragmented sentences (e.g., run-on sentences with multiple clauses)
[LEXICON]: Ambiguous phrasing in "the sixteen articles of the Spencerian creed" (unclear reference without context)

[LOGIC]: Sudden shifts between abstract philosophical concepts and biographical references (e.g., from "sixteen articles of the Spencerian creed" to "the affairs of the mind")
